review: Food was excellent!  Smoke and Pepper Burger with bottomless sweet potato fries and an Oreo milkshake hit the spot.  Girlfriend enjoyed grilled chicken sandwich wrapped in lettuce with bottomless steak fries and a root beer float.  Service was great as well! We hadn't had Red Robin since college and we're excited to see one pop up here in Baton Rouge.  Their burgers will give the local joints a run for their money.  Will definitely be return customers!

I visited during an exclusive night only before opening and it was Superb! Terrance was our waiter and he was very attentive. Very clean, food was fast, tasted great, Drinks were strong and good for the price. Décor was cool! Hope they stay around a long time!

Started off with chips, guacamole and Salsa. The guacamole dip was a little chunky, which I like, as was the salsa. So we started off on a good note. Daughter and I halved a Chilli Chilli burger and a Banzai Burger. Wife had a bacon cheeseburger. The Chilli was a little sneaky on the kick but it really good and the Banzai is basically like a Hawaiian burger, with the teriyaki and pineapple slices on it. All in all, everything was pretty awesome.  Also, if you like freebies, and who doesn't, they have a card with instructions on how to sign up for their emails and you can get a free malt to boot. Have it a go.

I visited before opening night and had an all together good experience. I've eaten Red Robin in three states now and the food is pretty much standard at each one you go to. If you are a burger lover, you will love it. I am not a huge burger fan, but I enjoy it. The waitress was kind, although you could tell she was very new. It bothered me that the manager stood behind her whispering in her ear as she tried to wait our table. First of all that is an experience kill and second of all you could tell it was making her very nervous. The atmosphere is very cool, the food is good, I'll be back when I want a burger and bottomless fries.

We were excited to come here for date night since we ate at red robin many years ago when it was at cortana mall... waiting to be seated didnt take long they sat us in the bar area which was loud we couldnt hear each other. Then there is the tables to small the chairs suck they swivel which made them hard to get   is a tip when ordering the bottom less fries order them with no salt they will be fresh hot and crispy then just sprinkle some of there signature seasoning on them.the burgers were OK not much season to the meat.over all we might come back one more time and sit in a booth on the other side of the restaurant and order something different if we have the same kind of experience. The restaurant next door will keep our business
My first time at a RedRobin. The service at this location was amazing, everyone that passed by was very attentive and the endless steak fries!!? Not a bad idea.

During our visit we waited 35 minutes to be seated and when finally provided a seat we requested a different seat due to being directly under the air conditioning vent. We were told that we would have to wait another 45 minutes if we wanted a new seat when there was sufficient amount of open tables. We found the climate to be too cold which made our food get colder faster. The waitress did not seem like she cared to bother with our request. The wrong meal was given to one of us and by the time we received the right order it was an hour later when the whole family already finished their meal. My husband burger tasted as if it was a frozen patty and nothing to go crazy for. The drink ordered was not strong at all and had more ice than anything. Tasted like flavored water with a drop of alcohol. Overall.. another disappointing resteraunt visit  for one of the large chains in the Baton Rouge area.

WHERE. DO. I. BEGIN??? Worst dining experience i've had in a very long time but i'll start with a positive. Well..THE positive. When we got there the place was packed. We were told it'd be a 20-25 minute wait for 2 which I didn't mind because it was pretty early in the day and I had to see what all the hype was about. The wait was only about 15 minutes maybe a little less. I now think that was because those in front of us turned down our table. It was THE worst seat in the house. Positioned right in front of the kitchen next to a small ledge where employees perched to gossip and complain right over us. Hated it! After about 5 minutes, we were greeted and drink orders were placed. We should have double fisted because getting a refill was almost impossible. For an app we ordered the short stack of onion rings which were really good with the ranch dip. After finishing and waiting for our entree orders to be taken another order of onion rings is brought to the table and once the server realized we've not only received but eaten some she leaves in a huff. Apparently there has been some sort of mix-up in the kitchen. Again I don't care to be involved. Finally orders are placed for burgers and the wait begins for 2 bbq burgers one topped with a fried egg and garlic fries. As we wait I could only think of the game Diner Dash. One by one customers at different tables blew their steam for a slew of things and I feared i'd be next. The manager popped in and out of the kitchen completely oblivious to everything going on around him...not the stretched eyes..not the scrunched foreheads.  When the burgers finally came we still had to wait for another 5+ minutes to eat them bc our server hadn't brought out any utensils or napkins. They're way to huge not to cut into. Once tasted, we agreed that they were just ok and going to Red Robin can be ticked off of life's to-do list never to be revisited.  Long story short...the witty commercials have brought the customers but sub par customer service and average food won't keep them. They need some help from Restaurant Impossible.
Place was nice but horrible service... Took them an hour n half to get apps...it was ridiculous wait...I have had better burgers than red robin burgers.., they def lost a customer

Went around lunch time had to wait around 25 minutes. The great thing is that they text you a link to see what your wait in line is, very helpful. Great service and nice atmosphere. The burger was good along with the fries.

Red Robins always remind me of the saying, "Self-glorification is not an endorsement." They tout they make gourmet burgers but they don't.  I became familiar with Red Robin in the late 70s in Northern California. And to this day, they prepare a good burger but not a gourmet burger. Yes, they offer different items to present burgers with fancy names. However, they do not offer burgers with exceptional flavor, which would make them gourmet burgers.  This location is no exception. It has the same old burgers presented with the same old standard congenial service worthy of three-star ratings.  And for Baton Rouge, Red Robin needs to introduce burgers with a local flair, like a Tiger Burger, and a Gator Burger, and a Red Robin Crawfish Po' Boy, with some Bottomless Cajun Fries.  And BTW, why do patrons have to ask for napkins and silverware? And why do Red Robins no longer use those liquid-absorbent coasters?

Me and a friend walked up to the restaurant to get something to eat and there was a waitress out front taking names and when we walked up she said "you can't be here". I have no idea why we couldn't be there but rather than give us an explanation we were told to leave.

Given that they're new they really have a lot of business . I was not that impressed with the food ! Had been wanting to try Red Robin after always seeing the commercials ! They Service was great but they fell short on the delivery ! Order came out wrong several times, but we tried to stay optimistic given the amount of people they had to serve ! Going to give them another try but not expecting too much ! As for now , not impressed !!

Hailee was the best server I have had since moving to Lousiana!  My boyfriend, friend, and I agreed that she provided the best experience we have had out in months.  The onion rings were amazing with the bbq type sauce, the pretzel bites were good.  My boyfriend devoured the new burger with the candied bacon on it, my friend enjoyed his chilli burger, I didn't make it to my chophouse burger because I filled up on my rootbeer float and apps. We will definitely ask to be seated in her section when we return, Hailee made the trip!

Can't comment on the food because we left before a table came available. Enjoyed when Red Robin was here before so thought we would try it again.  Told there was a 25 min wait. There was no space to wait so we wanted to get a drink at the bar but we were told we couldn't go over to that side of the restaurant with our 16 year old. Really?!?! Decided to dine elsewhere.

Went here for lunch.  Ordered the Tavern burger (non-fancy style lol) and steak fries.  The food was pretty tasty.  There was a lunchtime crowd, but the place was not packed.  There was only two of us today, but it took nearly 10 mins for a waitress (not ours) to come and get our drink order, another 15 to place an order, then another 30 mins for our food.  Could have been a four star just based on mine and my coworkers food alone, but the service has got to get better.  I understand that this place is fairly new though (I'm new to BR) so hopefully they get into gear.
Really good service. Mallory is amazing server! Yummy food & drinks coming back for sure.

It was one of the worst experiences ever. I went with another couple and we were seated right away near the door. It took fifteen minutes for someone to greet us and take our drink order. It took even longer for them to bring our drinks and take our food order. When ordering our food we were told it would be 30 minutes. It was an hour before we got our food. The server was nice but inattentive. She didn't refill our drinks until asked multiple times. I won't ever go back. I have worked in food service so I understand when things are busy but that was ridiculous.

Service was very good.  My friend's burger was fair, but "not worth the money".  My fish and chips was pretty awful.  The fries were mixed, some being hot and fresh while others were cold with the consistency of wet cardboard. The fish was obviously frozen with the aftertaste of freezer burn.  And whoever told them that to make food Southern just add powdered cane syrup to it should be shot.
Wonderful customer service and the burger was delicious. The close location to the mall and the movies was perfect for our group.

We went to Red Robin tonight for the first time.  The reviews were mixed but we decided you couldn't really go wrong with a burger.  WRONG! First, the burger was OK.  It was cold but that was probably because it sat there forever before our server ran it to us.  Speaking of service, this place has THE WORST SERVICE!!! We had to wait well over 30 minutes for our food to arrive when it clearly had been ready for a while.  She had to be flagged down for a refill during that wait and we had to ask her for it twice.  The poor people next to us didn't even get their drinks for a good 15 minutes.   Once our food came out we ate and quickly needed more fries.  They give you 10 fries if you are lucky.  We asked the server and waited...and waited.  She comes back and asks if we are together or separate.  I answer her but remind her about the fries.  She says they are coming and brings us the check.  Then she proceeds to completely clean our table.  Ummm, we aren't finished, we are waiting on more food.  We wait some more and I finally hand her my credit card.  She runs it and returns it and we tell her to not worry about the fries.  She has absolutely no response, just turns around and walks away. The manager was walking by and we got his attention and told him this was the worst service we have ever had.  He said he "wished he had known."  Well how about you walk around and ask your tables how their meal is going and if they need anything.  You would have known.  He has nothing to say besides that and even blamed the kitchen when we made it very clear the problem was our server. We will NEVER come back here.  Food could be OK if it was ran on time.  Service could not be worse.

Red Robin ... yum?? I went for the first time last night and knew I had to get one of their burgers they are so famous for.  Now, I won't say I'm an expert burgologist or anything, but I'm somewhat a connoisseur of burgers and all things beef.  And I'll simply day this ... I was underwhelmed by my meal.  Sure, the bottomless fries/sweet potato fries/broccoli will keep you coming, but if it were based on JUST the burger, there are plenty of better options in BR. When I eat an establishment's burger for the first time, there are a couple of tests I must perform to rate the flavor. The first, and most important, is tasting the beef alone. To get the full flavor profile of the patty itself.  Red Robin's patty was extremely bland. So I didn't even perform the other parts of the test. Just wasn't worth it.  I will say, however, they have a lot of interesting flavors that I would love to try. And lots of sauces to dip your fries in other than your simple ketchup.  Overall, the burger isn't amazing, but the different styles, buns and flavors, along with the bottomless fries, is enough to intrigue me enough to come back.

Went here tonight for the first time. Was decently crowded. Sat at a booth and was served immediately. Our drinks were good and tasty. And they have the calorie count online !!!! I got the garden burger and it was really good! Seriously impressed with the taste. Our server was super friendly, helpful, and nice! I will definitely come back here again.

Came in to have lunch. Waited about 40 min for our food to come out and when it finally did the fish was cold and my Burger had hair on it.  The manager was quick to fix it and took care of the bill.  I might give them one more shot.

Walking in I noticed it was kinda dirty and everyone was seated super close to each other. We were sitting abnormally close to a family when the entire restaurant was open. It was really weird. We ordered some drinks and they took about twenty minutes to come. The burgers were ok, nothing special. The service was pretty good though, the waitress was on top of her stuff. And then I went to the bathroom and the restrooms were so gross that it was enough to never want to go to Red Robin again.

So, we returned to Red Robin to see if there were any improvements from our visit 3 months ago. Service was much better. 50 minutes from entering to receiving our food.  The burgers are still average at best for a place that specializes in burgers.  Overall not bad if you've never had a really good burger. Chances are, if you think this place has great burgers, you haven't.

Went to Red Robyn at 11:30 on Sunday. There were 3 tables in whole restaurant and hostess said the wait is 25 minutes. When I questioned the wait he said sorry sir I understand. I did not understand and left. I will never go back!

In todays restaurant world it is not only the quality of the food that makes the experience memorable, but the quality of service as well.  Our latest visit to Red Robin was on a Saturday afternoon, right after seeing the new Avengers movie.  There was a 20-30 minute wait (which isnt bad), but after we were seated noticed that not all the tables were being used.   We sat at our table for what seemed like a long time (I wish I would have timed it to give specifics) before we were greeted by a lady who told us the server would be with us shortly.  After watching the girl wait on the table next to us and take away some plates she popped in at our table and said that she would be right with us.  Again, after what seemed like a very long period of time (we were able to discuss the menu and decide on our entrees) she came by to take our drink order.   After the urge to find another place to eat that had faster service had subsided, and our drink order had arrived; the rest of the visit went pretty well. I had the A1 burger and I would recommend it.  My boyfriend had some kind of burger with bacon and a spicy in house made ketchup. ( I wouldn't mind giving that a try either). Its crazy to think that one word could sum up such a concept, one that truly is YUM.

I should preface this review by admitting that I am not the biggest fan of large chains. That said, Red Robin does have an amazing selection of burgers.  We sampled their onion ring tower for our appetizer. They were good, but the best part were the sauces that were served with them. I ordered the chophouse Burger which came with onion strings, horseradish mushrooms, and a delicious mustard. It was a good mixture of flavors and textures. If you have a big appetite, upgrading to the garlic and herb french fries is worth it. For dessert, we sampled the doughnut tower and the milkshake. All in all, no complaints. I just prefer to eat at more local, "homegrown" places.

Bad food.  Our waitress was nice but poor processes made everything take soooo long. I ordered an Irish coffee shake (which was great), boneless breaded wings and a burger.  After eating 3-4 wings I realized the odd taste (I eat fast)...the last wing I ate was seared rather than cooked. I told the waitress who grabbed the manager. He came by and agreed the chicken wasn't cooked and asked what we wanted. We just asked to get the tab and never saw him again.  We were there for an hour +, paid $16 for drinks, and went next door to Grimaldi's.

The food was delicious and I love the bottomless fries. I was overwhelmed by the variety on the menu, they offer various sides and various sauces, and of course, various burgers. Our service was a bit slow but it appeared there was only one server for the bar area. The atmosphere was nice with various televisions and an abundance of seating. Everyone at my table seemed pleased with their burgers and fries! Good stop for either a before or after a movie or instead of eating the food court at the mall!

Our waitress didn't even take our drink order, someone else had to. We ordered an appetizer and other food. Another table sat down and ordered. Got their appetizer and waited on several times. She argued with another table about their order. We asked for manager and he proceeded to go to other tables around us, completely ignoring us. We asked to have our order to go. When they brought it out 20 minutes later, charging us full-price. We left and will not be returning.

It's your standard chain restaurant, nothing spectacular, but pretty good. We got the boneless wing appetizer and the chicken was good but I wasn't a big fan of the banzai sauce. I had the southern charm burger with bacon and caramelized onions. My burger was a little overcooked but all the toppings helped it out. The fries are really really good. The service was great. Everything came out well timed and our drinks were never empty. It was too expensive for a burger place though, there are plenty of other options in BR. But, if you're by the mall and craving a burger, it's definitely worth a try.

I wish I would have read these reviews before I suggested my husband and I try this place! First of all, like other reviewers have mentioned, a manager had to take our drink orders because our server wasn't yet available. We both ordered milkshakes that were actually pretty good. We also ordered the queso as an app. Our app was brought without any napkins or flatware which annoyed me a bit but I just blew that off. When it came time to order, our server asked if we wanted our burgers with some pink or no pink which I took to mean medium well or well done. I asked for the first option. Imagine my surprise when I bit into my burger only to taste almost completely raw beef. I felt sick to my stomach and asked my husband to please get a manager. The manager came over and apologized offering to remake the burger but we just asked for the ticket instead. I couldn't imagine eating anything else cooked at a place that would actually serve a raw burger. The manager was nice enough to take both of our burgers off the ticket. I suggest that anyone who likes cooked ground beef stay away from this place.

This was my first time here and I probably wouldn't come back. Upon entering there were lots of people waiting for a table and tons of tables empty so I'm not sure what the hold up was but we waited about 25 minutes which wasn't bad for a Friday evening. Our waitress was Robin who at first wasn't that friendly and seemed annoyed with us but towards the end lightened up and actually joked and smiled with us. Once we ordered it didn't take too long for the food to come out.  The food was mediocre and nothing really wowed us. I had the mini wedge salad and a bowl of French onion soup. The salad was ok and the soup I actually had to send it back which is probably the second time in my life I ever sent anything back. It was super salty and just inedible. The pretzel bits were great. The boneless buffalo wings were ok and the chips they were on top of were great.  Everyone at our table thought everything was ok and an ok experience. Maybe later on I would give them another try but not any time soon.

So I read the reviews about the bad service and under-cooked burgers, but thought I'd go see for myself anyway.  Our waitress, Hailee, was a delight.  She offered useful suggestions when questioned about the menu, kept our drinks full, and was generally friendly and helpful.  The food was good, but not phenomenal.  For Red Robin's prices, I expect to be amazed.  If the food matched the hype, I would have given it five stars.

I grew up eating at a red robin, so I really wanted to love this one. I gave the chain two opportunities to win me over, and I was disappointed on both visits. Servers were hit and miss. First one was awful (rude and not customer focused). I thought that, maybe I just caught them at a bad time. On the second trip, the server was nicer, but both orders were incorrect and cold. I figured since it wasn't a peak time, the food would improve. However, it was still bad. Avoid this one and hit up somewhere local.

Bummmmed! Really thought it was going to be great. Everything other than the greeter, ambiance and decor was terrible. The greeter was extremely nice and proved to be very helpful throughout the dinner. Courtney our waitress was not very helpful. The menu is overwhelming with a ridiculous number of items, and Courtney couldn't help us figure out what we wanted at all. Took 25 minutes to get our food, and once we did we still didn't have silverware or napkins. Food was bland and just a big let down. My girlfriend added salt to her burger and she said it made all the difference. I asked the greeter for one of all the different dipping sauces and attempted to flavor up my food as  I tried the different sauces. That was fun and interesting. Burgers, sweet potato fries, and garlic fries all were less than impressive. Even with them being bottomless they were pointless. Didn't even want to try the shakes as we were so let down. We got our check before we got our to go box, and Courtney apparently didn't want to give us one. She even gave us a small little box when it was obvious we needed one of their bigger boxes. I didn't feel like waiting another fifteen minutes for a box so I walked back to get one. When I asked Courtney for a bigger box she said they didn't carry any, and then I told her I saw the other table get one so  I know they have one. The greeter over heard the conversation and called Courtney out on the box situation. The greeter got one for me. In addition we were charged per coke on our bill! I've been to some of the fanciest restaurants in town, and it is extremely rare that this ever happens. Especially not at a Red Robin. Either Red Robin is hurting for profits, or now that I'm thinking about it Courtney inflated the bill for a bigger tip. That didn't work in her favor to say the least. Just a horrible experience all around. Not worth it one bit for a $15 burger. It sucks because I was really excited to go there. So long Red Robin.

This location is superior than the Houston one. The food is OK. My partner is a huge fan of their signature Royal Red Robin burger, whereas I'll generally order the guacamole bacon burger. Their unlimited bottom-less fries is a nice idea though I'm not a fan of wedge-style fries. I recently ordered the mountain high mudd pie as substitute for a lunch meal. That is no joke! It is a very large portion that one person alone cannot finish. Though their offerings do not blow me away, it is a place I will continue to go to.

Endless french fries, and are really tasty too boot. I'm not a fan of their burgers nor would I recommend going here for a great burger - there are plenty of other, BETTER choices around BR for that - BUT the salads I've had there (Harvest Chicken and Whiskey River BBQ) are good and the crispy chicken sandwich is good! The OK food is made up with a great, friendly staff who have done pretty good for either the large or small groups I've brought with me.

My wife and I went there for my birthday lunch. I was amazed that we did not have to wait to be seated, as it was a Saturday and it was close to noon. The waitress was super friendly and explained everything the we had questions about.  As we were waiting for our food, my wife commented that we must have come at a good time, because people were having to stand while waiting on a table. The burgers were really good and I put a hurting on the endless fries. I can't wait to go back!

We decided to go try Red Robin tonight.  The hostess was not at the front when we walked in.  There was a wait in spite of many tables being open.   I was hopeful when a waitress noticed the number of people at the front and helped to seat someone.  The hostess returned and asked the number of people in a party next to us.  After they answered she walked off with little acknowledgement.  She came back with an iPad to start taking names.   She never smiled or spoke clearly.  I noticed the floor was sticky in the waiting area; my shoes were sticking as I waited for my table.   We were led to a table after a short wait. The wait time of 5-10 minutes was accurate.  We were told our waitress would be with us shortly.  We sat at the table for another ten minutes and never had anyone even acknowledge us.  Several wait staff passed by.  There were many open tables around us.  No one appeared over worked.  We decided after watching another wait person walk by without even eye contact to leave and had a wonderful experience with the service at the nearby pizza place.
Just terrible.  Tried it twice, how do you get cold, 'fresh' burgers and cold fries.  Go anywhere but here.

Love their burgers. The whiskey burger is my ABSOLUTE favorite Yummmmmm!! I've never actually eating inside I always take my meal to go but the food is fantastic. I guess one day I'll have to eat inside and review the service.

My husband and I went to red robin so I could get my free birthday burger. Our server was a very pleasant lady but I wouldn't call her very professional. My fries were old and cold and when I told her she replied with, "Yah, probably." She then stared at me for a few seconds until I had to ask for new ones. It was a bit awkward.

Horrific dining experience. The restaurant was moderately full. We waiting at least 15 minutes for a waiter to come take our drink order and at least 15 more to take our order.  We then wait approximately 50 minutes to get our food. We are from out of town and on and tight schedule. We expressed this to the waitress after 50 minutes or so and she was quite rude.  Our food finally comes out about 10 minutes later. Two of the orders were completely wrong. The other two were cold when they received them.  We ended up having them take the two incorrect orders off and just leaving. They took care of the ticket but we were sad to have such a terrible experience. We will NOT be returning!

Wow, so Red Robin has come a long way from when I used to dine at one as a child. It's now become very trendy and have now added some pretty crafty craft burgers to their menu. This restaurant is huge and is a new addition "The Boulevard" (outdoor) section of the Mall of Louisiana adjacent to BJ's Brewhouse. I see why people flock here; it's a chain... why else? Chains of course are consistent and pretty much taste the same across the board. So, yes, it's comfortable! Our experience here was at the very end of our day after a fun-filled day of outdoor activities, so we were tired and hungry. Even though it was late and the server probably had a long day dealing with customers, I was happy to still see sparks of enthusiasm coming from her. She checked on us enough times to see how we were doing and was patient with us as we were indecisive on what to order. Their menu was extensive with burgers galore. If you don't plan on having a burger, don't come here because that is really what they are known for. I ordered my burger without a patty, which I do quite often and it was fairly decent - cooked the way I wanted it, but nothing really popped out at me. At that time I was just excited to eat anything because I was starving! This restaurant is open pretty late, so if you are looking for a late night bite, they will be available to serve you. I really did appreciate being promptly seated and wonderful customer service. So thank you Red Robin!

I happen to really like Red Robin.  Went to my first one in Denver in 1989 and I've been going back ever since.  I've been to at least a dozen over the years.   It is a chain, but the consistency is very good across the franchisees.  I went tonight to the one in BR for the first time to get my free birthday burger and it did not disappoint me.  I started with a sangria and ordered my favorite burger the Blue Ribbon with garlic herb fries.  Burger was cooked perfectly... Hot and juicy. The fries were hot and crisp.  Although I do like the garlic Herb fries, I do miss the old garlic parmesan version that came with chunks of garlic and loads of parmesan cheese.  The new version is garlic salt with sparsely and some parmesan thrown in.  Not the franchisees fault for the corporate wide change. I enjoyed my free burger and fries. I really liked the new menu pad at the table that comes loaded with games.  For $1.99 you can play until you cash out.  It kept me occupied for the entire meal.. Good thing I was dining alone.  Was very happy with the experience.

I've been here twice and both times I really enjoyed the bottomless fries!!! I am not really a burger person so I opted for the grilled chicken breast  the first time. You can tell the chicken was frozen and not fresh and it wasn't cooked all the way through. I enjoyed the mini donuts for dessert though..yum yum. Ok so round 2!! I opted for the grilled chicken salad this time and it was ok..nothing to really brag about. Again, I loved the bottomless fries!!! Took a bite of my sister's burger and it was good!!! Soooo I guess the burgers and fries are pretty good but if you are not a burger person then you may be up a creek!!! Overall, nice atmosphere and the service was good!!

Stopped in to try this place out. Food was good. Had the Smoke and Pepper Burger. Wasn't bad at all. The fries were good as well.  The service, now that sucked. Waited 15 mins for each beer. Fries are supposed to be "bottomless" but it seemed that they were reluctant to bring us more.  So if you're looking for a good burger RR will do, but there are much better options with better service.
Great food nice atmosphere. Mangers were really nice. Will definitely be back love the bottomless fries.
This was the most unorganized and unprofessional Red Robin I have ever been to.  Our meal was incorrect and not made right the second time around.

We ate dinner at Red Robin last night, for the first and maybe the last time. The decor was cool, the menu was extensive, and the drink options were different. However, the service was awful. From the time we ordered until when we got our food, 35 minutes passed. We had to ask our server to check our order for us, and I'm convinced she forgot to place the order. After she checked on our order, it was another 15 mins until we received our food. We then had to ask for silverware and napkins before we could eat, as my husband had ordered a really messy burger. His Royal burger and my plan cheeseburger were just fine. We liked the bottomless fries option, although we didn't ask for more. We liked the option to pay via an iPad at the table, which was great considering we only saw our server once more. I really wanted to like this place, but the service aspect really turned me off. Maybe we'll give it another shot. We were there at dinner time, so maybe our experience was an anomaly.

Weird, disappointing 1st and prob last visit. For a half empty restaurant the hostess was slow to seat us, she sat us next to people in a small table with a dirty table on other side, with half of restaurant empty we asked if we could move but she said we'd have to wait. Food was fair but small portions. Not impressed

2 *s...means "I've had better" and frankly I have had better...from price point to service to food I've definitely had better...Also the slogan on the side of building says "Gourmet Burgers and Brew"...be warned the Brew selection is laughable...so laughable I went with plain old H2O.... The location is great, the interior is going for a retro cool kinda vibe...seating is comfortable and the overall effect is relaxing... Walked in at 4:30 on a Thursday afternoon and other than a couple already seated me and the son were the only people in the place...a group of 6-7 came in after us and were served before us even though our order went in first...hmm  Went with the Big Tavern burger which is listed under the Tavern burger which is a double meat burger...no explanation about the Big Tavern so pardon me all to hell if you give me the impression the Big Tavern is also double meat but IT'S NOT... The Big Tavern is a "big" single patty that ain't that big...the Tavern is smaller patties in a double configuration...Honestly I'd hate to see the "small" patties after experiencing the "big" patty... Ordered the Garlic Herb fries which were a laugh just bland steak fries with some chopped green and cold garlic parmesan cheese thrown on top...ridiculous The son went with the Royal Red Robin...their take on a burger with a fried egg...the egg was way undercooked...hell looked like it had barely set...However the son was complimentary of the crisp bacon...Want a burger with a fried egg try Walk On's...just saying Oh yeah, I guess Gourmet Burgers don't come with onions and pickles...have to specifically ask...what kinda burger joint makes you request pickle and onion? A Gourmet Burger place I guess...

Went on a busy Friday night. Lukewarm burgers, hot fries, dirty floors, overall a sad experience. I will not be returning. Skip Red Robin and head next door to BJs for a way better atmosphere and food for the same price.
Great customer service! The burgers were great!Amanda was a real sweetheart . First visit and I can't wait to come again!

Had to go to the mall with a couple of friends tonight and after finishing up we decided to go to Red Robin. They had been before but this was my first time ever eating at one. Upon walking in, it took about 2 minutes of waiting before a host appeared which I thought was rather odd, especially since on a Monday night the place was nearly empty - maybe 4 or 5 other tables. After leading us to a dining area, there were a large number of tables all left unbussed. The host cleaned off a table and seated us, and our server was with us shortly. Their beer selection is honestly pretty pathetic. I had a blue moon while looking over the slightly confusing, book-like menu. Eventually I decided to split the Ghost Pepper cheese fries with a friend, and ordered the chili chili cheeseburger for my entree. After noticing that the bottomless fries could be substituted for bottomless steamed broccoli, I was quite enthusiastic. You have no fucking idea how much I love steamed broccoli. I also ordered a TNT to enjoy with my meal, which is basically their version of a long island but their drink menu made it sound really good, claiming that it is made with top shelf liquors. They definitely went heavy on the Beefeater gin, which I found quite pleasing. Overall I would highly recommend this drink and I'm not usually a long island drinker. The ghost pepper cheese fries were commendable; the ghost pepper sauce itself had a good flavor. A bit heavy on tomato sauce and not quite spicy enough for something calling itself ghost pepper sauce but the flavor was good regardless. The fries had what appeared to be a puddle of liquid cheese on them but upon closer inspection the cheese was more solid than liquid. It was quite strange but enjoyable nonetheless. The only thing I didn't like about them were the "fried jalapeno coins", which had so little jalapeno in them that they were basically fried balls of dough tasting like old grease. The burger itself was the most disappointing part of the meal, which is sad because that's what they're supposed to be known for. The actual patty was a completely flavorless pre-formed patty that basically looked like it came from mcdonald's. The bun was kind of stale. The chili was acceptable, but lackluster overall. The cheese on top had no attempt at being melted and the chopped onions were chopped so thick that I can still taste them. After a heavy dousing with mustard the burger became palatable, but still nothing to write home about. The steamed broccoli was good, but comes in probably the smallest bowl ever. I wound up eating 4 bowls of broccoli but the server would take a good 10 minutes between bringing your miniature bowl so it really wasn't that worth it. The last bowl was strange in that the stems were overcooked and mushy while the florets remained crunchy. They have a house seasoning in shaker bottles on the table that actually compliments the broccoli very well. The service was acceptable otherwise, and considering how much I ate and drank I don't feel that the $32 before tip was a bad price, though I do feel that they really need to work on improving their burger patties if they are going to tout themselves as a gourmet burger restaurant. I can make a better burger any time, any where. I'm quite confident I could make a better burger even after downing 20 of their quite potent TNT drinks.

Dined in on a rather slow Thursday at 630pm. Took a seat in the bar area which was empty. Greet pretty fast with a menu and asked for drink order. Then a couple more people came in. The manager on duty and bartender were joking around behind the bar and then the manger was joking and cutting up with the waitstaff on the other side of the bar after that. Ordered a chips and salsa app while figuring out my burger order. 5 mins later I ordered my burger. Burger came out pretty fast so fast that I didn't get my app yet. Then after my meal was dropped no one was around for 5 mins and couldn't find any ketchup anywhere. All and all it was really bad service esp on a slow night. Not sure if I would come back. I have been to other red robins and had amazing service.  Not sure what is missing with this one.. Leadership or certain standards.

Yummm is right me and my family have gone here over 5 times! And only one time had a bad server but tonight we had one of the best! When you come to Red Robin,ask for Mrs.Von,she'll do you right. Our food came out quick and correct and she didn't miss a beat when we asked for some extra fries and kept our drinks full! Will definitely ask for her next time we come. : D

This is my first and last time for red robin. The food was terrible. My bread was old and the items on it were unreconizable. We went when they opened thinking everything would be fresh, was I wrong. I think they used left over ingredients from the night before. The waiter was nice, and the diet cokes were good. C. Barrilleaux

This is probably the second time I've gone and I have to say I won't be back. It's a Monday night and there were only maybe three other tables on one side but the side I was on only had one other table. Service was very slow and the server got my order wrong. She was too busy at the back of the bar mingling with her co-workers. Will not be back.

I must commend Red Robin for their drinks and excellent customer service skills that are instilled into their employees. I cannot award this restaurant 5 stars due to the burgers not being above the quality of a rally's, or as our other guest suggested - McDonald's. Also it must be noted that any sauces ordered will cost extra.

They have excellent service! The food and drinks were very tasty!!! The server was friendly and helpful in deciding which burger was best. They offered an amazing selection of beer on tap. The chili cheese fries were good and the chili was fresh and the jalapeños were spicy! My pina colada was a sweet frosty treat!

The burgers are really good! What I really like, though, is that you can have a relatively healthy meal over here. The bottomless sides include broccoli or carrots (along with the usual fries), and I ordered my burger wrapped in lettuce. The kids both loved their Mac and cheese, which isn't something that my four year old generally eats. The conscience of being able to pay directly from the table, without having to wait for the check, is wonderful. We will definitely go back again!

Always pass by it when I'm at the mall and finally in the mood for a burger today so I went in for a quick bite during lunch time.  Ordered me a Banzai burger that comes with unlimited fries/steamed broccoli/salad. I'm a sucker for fries so I picked fries- they have their own seasoning salt you can add which is tasty!  The Banzai burger is basically a burger with grilled pineapples on it, I liked the pineapples but thought the hamburger meat is too salty and the buns did not hold up well, it became soggy within seconds! Overall, it tasted alright but not great. I also got a mint brownie milk shake which was good, nothing too special about it. Good came out fast and service was decent. They have tablet at each table so you can pay whenever you're ready so that's always a plus.

Entering the Red Robin on a rainy Monday afternoon I noticed only a sprinkling of clientele to match the weather outside. I made my way to the bar and took a seat. The bar area was well appointed with several TVs showing sporting events. The bar top, while obviously not meticulously cleaned, was not necessarily dirty, just not sparkling. I take this into account and decide it isn't an imperfection I would let dissuade me from pursuing this new to Baton Rouge venture known as Red Robin. A comely young bartender met me with a smile, handed me a menu and asked for my drink preference. I order a Dr Pepper and begin to peruse the menu. My eyes widen at the sight of juicy bovine deliciousness exploding off the page in high definition. I wondered what the differences were as they all appeared to have similar toppings choices, but then I noticed the pricing is all over the place. The young lady returns with my Dr. Pepper. "I've never been here before, is there anything special I should know about?" I ask. "Um. I don't think so" she responds in a tone that isn't dismissive, but definitely not as helpful as I was hoping. I decide that she's not in the mood for banter so I politely order a regular bacon cheeseburger.  The order is placed and I settle into my phone to read the news, occasionally glancing up to check out an interview with no sound on ESPN. After a short bit of time my food arrived. The aroma was heavenly and a slight hint of steam was rising from the glistening mass of ground tenderness before me. Large, steak cut fries accompanied the burger and I dove into them immediately as I am wont to do. This habit serves purpose twofold: my passion for French fries burns hotter than the fire stolen by Prometheus to allow man to create such delicacies AND to ascertain if they're hot and fresh. These fries were not piping hot, but not old. I turn my attention to the meat sandwich. The first bite was delightful. I could taste salt and pepper and meaty flavors, coupled with melty cheese and chewy bacon. The lettuce, tomato and onion complimented the hearty umami of the proteins and cheese in a way that added a crunch and a tang of sweetness to what was already an almost sensual exchange between taste buds and sustenance. I had to tell myself to slow down. If I rushed this experience I would soon regret not savoring each and every bite. I continued patiently. Not wanting the hot juices to be wasted on my chin, I bit carefully and slowly masticated each with as much care and love as the one before it.   My fries are gone now and the bartender asks if I'd like more. "You can do that?" I said incredulously. This was mostly for show because I had specifically given her the opportunity to explain when I told her I was a first time customer. She said yes, not catching my attempt to remind her of our earlier exchange. I surrendered my point, agreed to more, and went back to the main attraction in this gastronomic endeavor. Within a minute I was welcomed by a basket of fresh fries. Long, thick and golden. The bouquet of potato, salt and oil attacked my senses. Suddenly, I'm at a loss. This beautiful, meaty relationship I've been having for the last 5 minutes is suddenly thrown into question by a newly arrived jezebel named Hot Fries. I charge forward into the fries with reckless abandon. Not caring about the heat from the freshly prepared spuds, I feverishly cram them in my mouth. It burns the roof, lips are scorched but the pain only makes the salty goodness that much better. The fries are gone now as I lick the salt and oil from my fingers then shamefully use my napkin as I am brought back to earth from the ethereal plane to which I was whisked in the presence of freshly cooked carbohydrates.   Time to finish this burger. There are only two bites left, and after the massacre I just imparted on the fries, I took a minute to digest and clear my palate. The penultimate bite was as delicious as all those before it but the last bite was the best. The last piece of bun was permeated and stained with the grease and oil that was squeezed into it from each bite I'd taken previously.  It did not disappoint. The firm but juicy meat, still warm cheese and a soaked bun reminiscent of French toast but soaked with salty brine instead of maple syrup met my mouth in a crescendo of piquancy and sadness, as I knew the experience was now over.  I asked my server for the check and she pointed to the computer tablet mounted on the bar top. When she noticed my puzzled look she came over and flipped the screen and brought up my check. "Oh, I see" I exclaimed, again trying to remind her I was a first timer. Again, lost. I will be back but 4 Stars due to the uncleanliness of the bar top, the subpar first round of fries and the general nonchalance of the server. I do not expect or necessarily desire to be waited on hand and foot but I gave her opportunities to wow a new and hopefully returning customer and she choose the route of indifference.

Had the Burnin' Love burger with bottomless fries. And the fried pickles. The pickles were terrible, and the serving size was about 1/4 what we usually would expect. The dipping sauces with them were good. The burger was good, but the bun was overly dry. Steak fries are good, had the bacon aioli dip with them which was OK.

I  only giving 2 stars because of service. Food was great! No one was at hostess stand to greet us and after waiting a few minutes someone peeked around corner and stated they will be right back. After a few more minutes someone came up and said how many, not hello or sorry for the wait. We were seated in the bar area and our "waitress" was also the bartender. She was way more interested in the guy at the bar. Once we placed our order it wasn't long before the food arrived. It was delivered by someone else who seemed annoyed that I asked for a side of mayo. It took a few minutes but he finally brought it. The waitress never checked on us to see if we needed drink refills or more of the bottomless fries they advertise. I also wanted dessert but she never came. We used the automated checkout they have at the table and had to try several times because it wanted me to tip 20% and the tip I choose to leave was significantly less. I will tip 20% or better when the service justifies it, this service did not.
So disappointed with our $13 hamburger. It was so dry, and not much to it for the price. I won't be going back. The service wasn't great either.

I don't if it's because I was super hungry when I ate here, but I loved this place. My boyfriend and I grabbed some lunch here before the LSU game. I won't lie, I was pretty excited- after seeing Red Robin commercials for years, I was ready to FINALLY see what all the fuss was about. They had a special burger which was a two patty burger with mac and cheese in the middle. It was like a cheeseburger with a twist! Of course, it came with their steak fries, so I was all about it. This burger was so good! The mac and cheese was perfect with the burger and I loved that it was a good size but not HUGE. The fries were perfectly cooked and tasty. I also I had a beer that came in a nice big mug that stayed cold. I think it's neat that they have an iPad type thing at every table, so that you can pay when you are ready- that's really convenient. Service was great and the atmosphere was laid back and fun. I will definitely be back when I am in the area.

Always wondered what happened to Shoney's. Must have just renamed themselves Red Robin. The burger (Smoke & Pepper burger) isn't bad....but there's a hundred places to get a better burger, including McD's. It's looks like a pre-formed frozen patty from Win-Dixie...with less seasoning. Chicken strips and shrimp were cooked directly from the back of the Sysco truck. I won't avoid this place, just won't voluntarily go back.

This place went from fantastic to "never again". We went one Saturday for lunch, but they told us it would be over an hour, so we waited until the next week. We were seated in a corner where a bang sound came from the wall right behind me for the ENTIRE meal. Our waitress was frazzled and we barely saw her. I tried to use my free birthday burger, so typed my number in, but the burger didn't come off. We asked the waitress about it, and then some guy came to the table saying it wasn't covered and was kind of rude. Then the table kiosk wouldn't print a receipt. I contacted customer service about the issues, and I got a cookie cutter response asking me for more detail, which I provided, only to get another email saying sorry for the miscommunication, that's it. I then emailed asking if my burger was covered under the birthday deal, they said yes it was!! I'm just not going to bother going here again, not with so many great burger joints in town that treat a customer better than Red Robin did.

You know, I hadn't been into Red Robin for a while.. so tonight I decided to order some takeout for the family. Reggie, who took my order was super nice and very knowledgeable and helpful about my menu questions! There are lots of great burger choices, finally my husband and I selected the Southern Charm burger and a tower of onion rings and my daughter ordered the sautéed shroom burger w garlic Parmesan fries! Then Reggie made the s'mores milkshakes sound so amazing that we literally all got them, couldn't resist, super deliciousness. We will go back again soon!

Our waitress was great, very friendly. The food took awhile to arrive. And when it did I was immediately disgusted. I ordered the pub mac and cheese with bacon, endless salad. I'm not sure what I was served but it was definitely not what was described on the menu. I promptly sent it back and settled for a burger. The salad wasn't anything great either. Brown, wilty lettuce, not very appetizing but I was starving so I ate it. There needs to be an improvement on the quality coming out of the kitchen. While they took off the charge for the Mac and cheese, no other apologies were made. The fact my bf was completely done with his dinner by the time I got mine? Ugh! Very dissatisfied.
Fantastic burger "Big Buzz Mac & Cheeseburger". Cool environment for lunch and nostalgic and current music playing. Great place.
in dine room was too cold  i asked the waiter to turn off the ceiling fans  he ignored my request   Outside is cold too  I will not come back again

First and last time ever ! Food came pretty quick but had to be sent back because it was cold my grandmother ordered a grill cheese sandwich looked very appealing she ate half of it and BAM mold on her bread ! That was he most disgusting thing I have ever seen hopefully it doesn't make her sick ! Will never eat from here again

I was greeted by the hostess when I walked in with a great smile and I was seated immediately in the bar area . My server was Tammy . She was friendly, assertive,and very attentive and knowledgeable of the menu . The Restaurant as well as the restrooms were pass just clean, they were immaculate . I was very surprised.  My food was hot, fast, and fresh . The burger was actually good and moist better than fast food places. Still not like home a made burger .  I will visit again.

I got the French onion soup bowl. Trust me it is not enough to fill you up. Get an appetizer to go with it. It was delicious though! My husband got a burger with the unlimited fries. I had half and they were also really good. The place is always well kept up and the staff are friendly. We love eating here.

We arrived at prime lunch time and was seated immediately. We told our waitress we never been here and she immediately informed us how the menu is laid out and even made a few suggestions. Our food came out quickly and everyone at the table enjoyed everything they had. We will definitely be back!

Walked in, Saturday around 8:45pm. The place was pretty empty but we stood at the front waiting to be acknowledged for about 5 minutes. We weren't greeted, just was asked how many people needed to be seated, (it was the manager). After we were seated the manager walked away and started fussing at a guy, that guy would be our server. He ended up doing a good job but the environment was very unclean so that's why I give 2 stars. Looks like management is the issue here.

Got off to a rough start with a longer than expected wait.  Server was attentive and really nice.  Food was good. Really enjoyed the pretzel bites with the beer cheese dip.  My burger and onion rings were perfect and so was the fiancé'Chili Chili burger and garlic herb fries.  Topped it all off with delicious Salted Caramel milkshakes.

A five star performance. The burgers were hot, juicy, and delicious. This was the best experience we've ever had at any burger store including this store.  It wasn't just the food and the atmosphere this time.  It was actually the service that beat all.  Our waiter, Aaron(not sure of spelling), was the most attentive waiter I have ever witnessed. He never had anybody searching for him because he checked every table each time he came back and forth.  This guy is a real gem in a business that is symbiotic with transient and sometimes subpar labor. If I had a restaurant I would want to hire people like Aaron.
This was terrible. A cold burger, near frigid beans, and the bar was incapable of crafting a simple gin and tonic. Avoid this place like the plague.

To start this off I want to say .... not only is this the cutest place every but its the best ! So the service was great, we were immediately seated and they took our drink orders. I decided on the Madlove burger.  While our food was coming out our wonderful waiter bought us some fries and dipping sauces for the "long" wait ... sis WHAT WAIT??? They made sure we were very well attended. After, our food came out & LET ME JUST SAY that was love at first sight. The burger was delicious, one of the best I had every tried. The fries ??? AMAZING.  As a burger lover I can say this is one of my new faves.... for sure.

Well it looks inviting from the outside but there was no one to welcome me on the inside. After standing at the entrance for 5 minutes waiting to be seated I decided to just sit at the bar. The bartender was very pleasant with lots of knowledge about the menu and drink specials . The food was mediocre, not what I'd call gourmet, yet still appetizing . The milkshakes and root beer floats are spot on and the bottomless steak fries is a plus for a person on a budget. I recommend Red Robin for families or a quick bite with friends.

Continuing my burger streak... This place has been great too! Got the Marco Polo with the chicken patty, fries and Garlic Aioli sauce (5 stars!). It was a massive burger; sauces perfectly paired and succulent chicken. And did I mention its a veggie-friendly place where you can subsitiute with their custon veggie patties?!?! Pretty good selection of drinks (alc/non-alc). I got the Orange Cream Soda.. bottomless!! I will surely come back here. Would. Definitely. Recommend.
